medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower extremity weakness and neck pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior to admission with gradually worsening pain in the neck, lower back, and below the knees, which awakened the patient from sleep. By the evening before admission, the patient was unable to stand or use his right hand, and weakness progressed to involve the entire right side and eventually the left lower extremity. On the morning of admission, sensory decrease in both lower extremities and urinary incontinence were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No chronic medical conditions; up-to-date immunization status.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lived with his parents and a healthy 6-year-old brother; had sustained multiple cat scratches on his fingers and wrists from his grandmother's indoor cats.
